sentences: Sonny Phillips (born December 7, 1936) is an American jazz keyboardist.
His primary instrument is electronic organ
Phillips began playing jazz organ after hearing Jimmy Smith in his twenties.
He studied under Ahmad Jamal, and played in the 1960s and 1970s with Lou Donaldson, Nicky Hill, Eddie Harris, Houston Person, and Gene Ammons.
His debut album was released in 1969, and he released several further records as a leader before suffering a long illness in 1980.
He went into semi-retirement after this and moved to Los Angeles; since then he has performed and taught occasionally.
My Black Flower (Muse, 1976; reissued on 32 Jazz in 1999)
Legends Of Acid Jazz: Sonny Phillips (Prestige, 1997) (compilation of Sure 'Nuff + Black On Black!)
If You Could See Me Now (Muse, 1978)
Don't Misunderstand: Live In New York (High Note, 1980)With
